body: Latest nits squashed in and last junit OCD CI run [here](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/bereng/cassandra/584/workflows/0955f6d7-9776-4cb3-b6bc-7528a52aa704)

@blerer Updated the `testDescribeRoundtrip()` test with materialized view creation and assertion.
merged with https://github.com/apache/cassandra/commit/d543dae2cd0d6540d95eb3252d79e75393fd993d
In the meantime the docs migration was also finished. So we need to consider also updating the Virtual Tables page

Made code changes (by using position + write a byte) to set length of a file and removed checkstyle exceptions for RandomAccessFile except one place: org.apache.cassandra.io.compress.CompressedRandomAccessReaderTest#updateChecksum which is using FileDescriptor.

CI [j11](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/bereng/cassandra/587/workflows/b07dbd6a-725e-433f-80dc-b32f5f3cbcf3)
CI [j8](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/bereng/cassandra/587/workflows/efd480e6-b8ad-4ac1-8dcb-7fcd841814f1)

Some other changes I recommend:
* In CommitLogSegmentManagerCDC, remove the Arrays.stream slower on Windows comment
* In CompactionTask:175, remove the comment about ifile and dfile on Windows
* In PathUtils.java, remove the comments about Windows being picky about renaming
Merged manually with https://github.com/apache/cassandra/commit/e4c6b8e1ed64f92ab7d6008730504a48fe9ee3c4

hi @sarankk , could you create a ticket in jira.apache.org for Cassandra project? thank you.

Committed manually

Great, thanks, the PR looks good to me. I'll run CI tests once it's rebased on trunk. The relevant changes introduced in [CASSANDRA-17353](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-17353) are just the unnested config and renaming "abort" thresholds by "fail".
Resolved conflits.
Sorry about that, I missed those during the merge.
I need to fix the hard coded credentials in PlainTextAuthProvider(username='cassandra', password='cassandra')
@adelapena please let me know if you need anything else on this from my side. Else, you can submit this for CI.
Hi I was wondering about the revert of the test?
Just moved that into another branch. I'd like to fix it, but currently I didn't found how.
I have already run CI for this. The results are on the JIRA ticket, and they look good to me. Now we need the approval of a second reviewer before committing.

In JIRA and in private conversation between myself, Paulo and Josh we agreed that for time being, for checks which are currently resolving system properties to configure themselves, that mechanism will be still in place but the configuration via cassandra.yaml will be possible too, system properties would take precedence over what is in yaml. I marked system properties as deprecated. In 5.0, we will get rid of system properties completely as there will be different mechanism to set system properties for cassandra.yaml configuration @dcapwell is working on.
nit: `throw UnsupportedOperationException` from LCS version of `partialCompactionsAcceptable()`

The first 400 runs failed which confirms we can repro the error. This [one](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/bereng/cassandra/589/workflows/ee096147-e44b-4e3f-a97a-b62162063dd1) passes with the fix.
Resolved review comments, ready for another look :)

@smiklosovic I just realized that we should also add the documentation for the configuration keys itself like [here](https://cassandra.apache.org/doc/4.0/cassandra/configuration/cass_yaml_file.html#server_encryption_options).

Hi @thingtwin1 , does this have JIRA in jira.apache.org by any chance? Maybe guardrail would be better for this? @adelapena ?

@smiklosovic I think this is [CASSANDRA-17370](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-17370), and indeed it could be done with a guardrail (a [DisableFlag](https://github.com/apache/cassandra/blob/trunk/src/java/org/apache/cassandra/db/guardrails/DisableFlag.java)). Besides standarization, I think that doing this as a guardrail would give us the ability to exclude internal queries and superusers, better logging, extensibility and, in due time, diagnostic events and access through virtual tables.

@michaelsembwever  This work was squashed and committed almost two weeks ago, should I just close this pull request? I am not sure what is the process as normally we use pull requests against our own forks during review.

@ErickRamirezAU 
> @taku333 Thanks for the PR.  Have you already raised a ticket for this?

Hello. I have not issued any tickets here yet.
Is there a link or other information that describes the procedure for issuing tickets?

@taku333 Details + links to are documented here -- https://cassandra.apache.org/_/community.html#how-to-contribute. To log a Jira ticket, [click here](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/CreateIssue.jspa?pid=12310865). Cheers!
